title: 820-00165 no backlight.
message:
Liquid damaged.
bklt bins burnt off on the LVDS connector, replaced it, twice.

LED Driver had a burnt out pin 8, replaced it too.

Still no backlight. I'm getting ~8.5v on 3 & 4 of J8300.

title: 820-00165 no backlight.
message: Feedback trace to ball A5 checked? BKL_EN and PWM present?

title: 820-00165 no backlight.
message:
Yes, I checked the trace when I replaced the LED Driver.

BKL_EN and PWM are missing, one both boards.


[SUB]I have three of them that have come back now with all similar problems.
Could it be a bad batch of LED Drivers?[/SUB]

I'm guessing pin 1 of R7704 shouldn't measure 0.000 in diode mode?

title: 820-00165 no backlight.
message: Is there even an image?

title: 820-00165 no backlight.
message: Definitely an image.

title: 820-00165 no backlight.
message: Did you check the fuse?

title: 820-00165 no backlight.
message:
Yeh, I did.

Check it every now and then in case I blow it while working as I have done once before.

title: 820-00165 no backlight.
message: If there really is 8.5V on the backlight rail the BKL_EN must be present as it is a simple resistor devider off that rail. Double check and don't assume anything.

title: 820-00165 no backlight.
message:
I just noticed that I am getting an unstable reading on D7701

It goes from 8.59 down to about 6v then back up again. Ever now and then it seems to drop to 0v.

Any idea what that means?

title: 820-00165 no backlight.
message: Pin 3 of Q7706? You are measuring with an LCD connected I hope.

title: 820-00165 no backlight.
message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 23896"]Pin 3 of Q7706? You are measuring with an LCD connected I hope.[/QUOTE]

Q7706::3 = 2.843v

D7701 is stable now. I measured it several times before to make sure it was fluctuating....

These three backlight boards are sending me loopy.

title: 820-00165 no backlight.
message: Then we are back to the simple resistor divider on BKL_EN so that must be present. BKL_PWM present too?

title: 820-00165 no backlight.
message: BKL_PWM with a DMM is 1.46v

title: 820-00165 no backlight.
message: Come on, I also need to know if BKL_EN is there of course.....

title: 820-00165 no backlight.
message: It is, at 2.84v @ R7715

title: 820-00165 no backlight.
message: PWM is too low. Have you done a PRAM reset? Is SMC_LID high?

title: 820-00165 no backlight.
message:
SMC_LID is 3.3

I have performed an PRAM reset.

I tried putting 3v on BKL_PWM to get the screen at full brightness, but nothing changed.

title: 820-00165 no backlight.
message: I have no other ideas. It is either a bad LP8550, badly soldered, corroded feedback trace to ball A5. There is nothing more to these.

title: 820-00165 no backlight.
message:
Are bad LP8550s a thing?

The last batch (10, used 5) I bought, each one has come back with some sort of problem that looks like a backlight issue.

Another just came back with a flickering backlight....

title: 820-00165 no backlight.
message: Nope, never had an issue with them. Check your work and always inspect the feedback trace.

title: 820-00165 no backlight.
message:
Guess that means it has to be me.

[img]http://cdn.sheknows.com/articles/2012/06/crying-baby.jpg[/img]
